CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 21, 1964, pg. 6 reads: "The D.I.'s In Sheets - The fashionable members of the D.I. Club, who are noted for being among the best dressed in Pittsburgh, turned out in sheets, draped and pinned to look like gowns, for their benefit last Sunday at the Hilton Hotel. Left to right: Mildred Conner, Margaret Watson, secretary; Nellye Barron, financial secretary; Mary Jean Eaton, honorary member, of Los Angeles, Calif.; Birdie Dunlap, Juanita L. Drake, president; Alberta Thompson, Gloria Grate, treasurer, and Evelyn Christian, co-chairman. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Nine members of the D.I. Club, left to right: Mildred Conner, Margaret Watson, Nellye Barron, Mary Jean Eaton, Birdie Dunlap, Juanita L. Drake, Alberta Thompson, Gloria Golden Grate, and Evelyn Christian, wearing light colored sheets with brooches, standing in row in interior of Hilton Hotel for benefit
